channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2023100320
item.description:
Report X-2023100320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to our attention by a driver. Placed in a leaker hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage for proper handling. DescribePack: Pinhole size puncture at bottom of bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat leaker tote

item.title: Report X-2023082081
item.description:
Report X-2023082081

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the morning sort at our ramp location in Romulus MI, a plastic Jerrican was punctured containing UN 3264, Corrosive liquid, acidic, inorganic, n.o.s (Aluminum Hydroxychloride) at the bottom of the piece. It was seen that during the ULD loading process, the jerrican was placed on an unseen protruding rivet causing the puncture and allowing for an estimated 236 mL to escape. No other packages were compromised because of this leak. The jerrican was contained in a salvage drum to prevent further leakage. Consignee was contacted to inform customer of the damaged package and inquire for disposition.
